Grouped_Utterances: Yes, actually! I was able to get enrolled in an online history course.   I want to volunteer with kids, maybe at a local school or community center.

I've been okay, a bit up and down, but I'm managing.   I'm excited but also a bit anxious. It's been a while since I've been in a learning environment.   I guess I worry about keeping up with the work and if I’ll be able to handle it.   I’ve had a few more good days than bad, which is nice.   I’ve had a few less intense nightmares, which is a relief.

I think focusing on my goals and having a plan has helped.   I just want to help them see their potential, like I didn’t always see mine.   Yes, I’m trying to be more proactive.   It feels empowering, like I'm finally taking control of my life.
Sometimes I feel overwhelmed, like I’m taking on too much at once.   I guess I’m just worried about how I’ll manage everything.

Okay, um… I have school, volunteering, and then I want to work on my health too.   I think school should come first, then volunteering, and health last.   I feel good about it. It feels more doable now.
I’ve been trying to remind myself to take things one step at a time.   I’ve been practicing that breathing technique we did last time.

Not yet, but I plan to start researching soon.   Yeah, I could set a daily study goal for school, like an hour a day.   I could aim to find one opportunity this month.   I can try to walk a bit each day, maybe start with 10 minutes.
